Bluetooth page has no scan result
Do not auto-connect when one device is already connected

note.body:
This has a lot of potential side-effects, like the one I mentioned earlier of the devices cycling through their pairings and trying to connect to something else, or thinking they lost their pairing.

Feel free to bring this up to the bluez mailing-list, this isn't something that we could do in gnome-bluetooth, as it doesn't have any policy components outside of the Settings panel, and that's not running in the background.

target_title: Do not auto-connect when one device is already connected

note.body:
Thanks for the prompt answer. 

I can do something on the computer: `bluetoothctl untrust` will block auto connection. 
Obviously that will eventually become inconvenient in a different moment, when you actually want it to connect. 

If "untrust" can block the auto-connection, I figure something similar  can just block it "unless" no other device is already connected.

target_title: Do not auto-connect when one device is already connected
Do not auto-connect when one device is already connected

note.body:
> What happens: laptop autoconnect to earbuds and also switch to them.

This isn't what's happening. Your earbuds are the ones auto-connecting to the computer. You can verify this by:
1. putting the earbuds in their case
2. removing the pairing in Bluetooth settings
3. closing the Bluetooth settings
4. launching `bluetoothctl` on the command line
5. Seeing that the earbuds are trying to connect to your computer when you take them out of their case

There's nothing that the computer can do, this is common behaviour across all Bluetooth audio devices, usually connecting to the last used host, sometimes cycling through last-used hosts if they support multiple pairing.

On some devices, this behaviour can be turned off, you'll need to check in the user manual for your device to see if that's possible.

target_title: Do not auto-connect when one device is already connected
